page.title: 03WALTON HURST - MIXED FARMING
page.content: Walton Hurst is the largest farm on the estate belonging to Lord Lichfield. The present tenant took over from his father in 1973. His son, likewise, will inherit the tenancy. The farm comprises 396 acres divided into 15 fields. This year there are 126 acres of wheat, 54 winter barley, 12 spring barley, 12 peas (which have failed). The rest is for silage. A herdsman, tractor driver, a relief herdsman/stockman and the herdsman's wife work for the farmer. There is an average of 120 Friesian cattle, of which 60 are in milk and the rest are calving. Currently there are 30 in-calf heifers and 39 year- old heifers. All bull calves are sold. Cattle are sent to market every week.
